intro: Chamissoa albida, commonly known as the white chamissoa, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its pale white to cream-colored flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or shrubland habitats. Chamissoa albida has lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine layer of white hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries.
